intro: Maripa cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf maripa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and wetlands. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
